chapter.title: Adding social
chapter.subtitle: Movies 2.0
chapter.para: So far, the website had only been a plain old movie database (POMD?). We now wanted to add a touch of social to it.

section.title: Users
section.para: So we started out by taking the User class that we'd already coded and made it a full-fledged Spring Data Neo4j entity. We added the ability to make friends and to rate movies. With that we also added a simple UserRepository that was able to look up users by ID.

example.title: Social entities

section.para: We extended the DatabasePopulator to add some users and ratings to the initial setup.

example.title: Populate users and ratings

section.title: Ratings for movies
section.para: We also put a ratings field into the Movie class to be able to get a movie's ratings, and also a method to average its star rating.

example.title: Getting the rating of a movie

section.para: Fortunately our tests highlighted the division by zero error when calculating the stars for a movie without ratings. The next steps were to add this information to the movie presentation in the UI, and creating a user profile page. But for that to happen, users must first be able to log in.
